intro: Scandix grandiflora f. hispidula, commonly known as the hairy scandix, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
